name: IDeATe: Essentials of Woodworking
long_desc: PLEASE NOTE The specific Friday meeting dates for the A2 section of this micro course are Fridays Oct 31, Nov 7, Nov 14, and Nov 21.  Civilization has advanced in parallel with woodworking as a craft. This course introduces techniques for safety, materials selection, cutting, joinery, and routing. Including an overview of the process of making useful and decorative objects from wood. Project and lab based instruction.

custom_fields.goals: Students will gain knowledge and skills in working safely and efficiently with hand tools and power tools. They will be introduced to different types of woods and their uses.
custom_fields.key_topics: Types of woods - wood categories and building materials will be overviewed; Planning- Basic planning techniques and materials selection will be practiced; Safety - Safety for hand and power tools will be demonstrated and certified; Sanding and Finishing- The students' projects will be self-evaluated for quality.; Joint Construction- The students' projects will introduce basic joinery.
